item.title: Bangladesh to seek delay in LDC graduation, says Commerce Minister
item.description: The newly elected BNP government will take necessary steps to defer Bangladesh’s graduation from the Least Developed Country (LDC) status, Commerce Minister Khandaker Abdul Muktadir said on Wednesday. “We will take all required measures to defer the LDC graduation. Work on the matter h

item.title: PM’s address to nation rescheduled for 9:45 pm
item.description: Prime Minister Tarique Rahman's maiden address to the nation has been rescheduled for 9.45pm on Wednesday, according to a press release issued by the Information and Broadcasting ministry this evening. Bangladesh Television (BTV) will telecast the speech live while all television channels have bee

item.title: Govt won’t allow a patronage economy to continue: Finance Minister
item.description: Finance and Planning Minister Amir Khasru Mahmud Chowdhury on Wednesday underscored the need for the democratisation of the country’s economy so that its benefits reach all the people. “We can’t allow a patronage economy to continue,” the minister told newsmen at his Bangla

item.title: Women entrepreneurs share their journeys ahead of SME fair
item.description: Women entrepreneurs have underscored the importance of resilience, institutional backing, and family support in overcoming barriers and sustaining their businesses, as they shared their journeys ahead of an upcoming SME fair organised by MIDAS. They were speaking at a one-day CMSME Market Readines

item.title: Arrest warrant issued against UK MP Tulip
item.description: A Dhaka court has issued an arrest warrant against British Labour MP Tulip Siddiq in a corruption case over a flat in Gulshan. Metropolitan Senior Special Judge Md Sabbir Faiz passed the order on Wednesday after taking cognisance of the charge sheet filed by the Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC).

item.title: Chicken, chickpeas, fruit prices jump in Dhaka before Ramadan
item.description: The prices of chicken, chickpeas and fruits have surged in Dhaka’s kitchen markets ahead of Ramadan, driven by rising demand and tighter supplies, adding fresh strain on household budgets. A visit to several markets in the capital on Wednesday found that the prices of chickpeas, lentils, pou

item.title: Media leaders urge unity, action over attacks on Prothom Alo and Daily Star
item.description: Condemning the recent attacks on media outlets, senior journalists, newspaper owners and other stakeholders on Wednesday underscored the need for strengthening unity among them to face any challenges in the coming days. They also urged the government to take necessary steps against the people dire

item.title: Ishraque wages ‘war’ against price-gouging before Ramadan
item.description: State Minister for Liberation War Affairs Ishraque Hossain has pledged strict action against market syndicates and those hoarding goods to spike prices during Ramadan. He announced on Wednesday on his verified Facebook page his zero-tolerance policy against those creating artificial crises and inc

item.title: Two bodies found dead on Cox’s Bazar beach
item.description: Police recovered the bodies of a young man and a young woman from a beach along the Marine Drive road in Teknaf upazila of Cox’s Bazar on Wednesday. One of the bodies was found near Uttar Lombrori and another near Mitapani Chhara boat terminal areas. Locals spotted the bodies and informed p

item.title: Police deliver credible, acceptable election with utmost sincerity: DMP Commissioner
item.description: Sheikh Md Sazzat Ali, Commissioner of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP), on Wednesday said the police have delivered a free, fair and widely acceptable election with the highest level of sincerity and dedication. He made the remarks while addressing DMP members as the chair at the monthly crime

item.title: By-elections to Bogura-6, Sherpur-3 soon after Eid: EC Masud
item.description: The Election Commission will hold by-elections to two parliamentary seats – Bogura-6 and Sherpur-3— soon after Ramadan. “We don’t want any election in (the month of) Ramandan. We’ll arrange by-elections to the vacant parliamentary seats soon after the Eid-ul Fitr,&rdq

item.title: Prime Bank, Hyatt Place Dhaka Uttara sign deal to offer exclusive deal
item.description: Prime Bank PLC has signed a strategic partnership agreement with Hyatt Place Dhaka Uttara to offer an exclusive deal including Buy One Get One (B1G1) offer.
